qas.question: What historical event once again freed Estonia?
Following the Soviet collapse what became the only official Estonian Language?
What language was no longer promoted as one of Estonia's main languages?
What came into being in January 1989?

answers.text: The Law on the Status of the Estonian Language

qas.question: What historical event once again enslaved Estonia?
Following the Soviet rise what became the only official Estonian Language?
What language became less popular prior to the Soviet collapse?

plausible_answers.text: The Law on the Status of the Estonian Language

qas.question: What came into being in February 1989?

plausible_answers.text: the restoration of Republic of Estonia's independence

qas.question: When was Russian encouraged to be used in Estonia?

context: During the Perestroika era, <a3_0><b7_0>The Law on the Status of the <a1_0>Estonian<a1_0/> Language<b7_0/><a3_0/> was adopted in January 1989. The <a0_0><b4_0>collapse of the Soviet Union<b4_0/><a0_0/> led to <b8_0>the restoration of Republic of Estonia's independence<b8_0/>. Estonian went back to being the only state language in Estonia which in practice meant that use of <b5_0>Estonian<b5_0/> was promoted while the use of <a2_0><b6_0>Russian<b6_0/><a2_0/> was discouraged.
